Datatable:
Intruders A small vessel has just been picked up on your long-range scanners. It is moving at extremely high speeds--far exceeding the capabilities of most civillian ships--and it seems to be in a hurry to reach its destination.
While you can't be sure, the vessel appears to have entered your space from foreign territory.
Intercept Intercept the ship. Divert one of your patrolling warships to intercept the vessel.
You will learn more about the vessel.
Ignore Ignore the ship. Ignore the vessel. Keep your warships on patrol at your borders. You will conserve your resources for more dangerous threats.
Shuttle Disabled Your warship breaks from the border to intercept this mysterious intruder.
At first, they try to outrun you; the vessel--a small, military-grade shuttle--makes a beeline towards some point deeper in your empire's space. When it becomes clear that you're going to catch up, the shuttle then alters course and tries to hide behind a moon. When you find them, the shuttle makes one final, desperate race out of the system before they are disabled by the superior firepower of your warship.
Board Board the shuttle and take prisoners. Board the shuttle and take prisoners. You want to know where they came from and why they were in your space. You will learn more about the shuttle.
Destroy Destroy the shuttle. Order your warship to destroy the helpless vessel. You will send a message to your enemies about the dangers of trespassing in your territory. Your enemies will think twice before trespassing.
Enemy Crew Captured There is a brief firefight as you take the shuttle and its crew. Two enemy space marines are killed when you board and you manage to take another three after they surrender. They also have a female, civilian scientist on board.
They immediately identify themselves as citizens of a neighboring, rival empire. This civilization is quite powerful, although they have been duplicitous towards you in the past.
Mere hours after they are captured, you recieve a formal diplomatic message from their empire. According to their government, this shuttle was responding to an emergency on the other side of your territory, outside of your sovereign space. They apologize for the misunderstanding and request that their citizens are immediately returned to them.
Meanwhile, your soldiers have been questioning the prisoners and they believe that there is more to this story.
Interrogate Continue to interrogate the prisoners. Continue to interrogate the prisoners. You want to know the truth behind their secret mission. You will learn more about their mission, but their empire will be upset.
Torture Torture the prisoners. Torture the prisoners until they break. Order your soliders to apply increasingly harsh methods until they get everything from the space marines and their female charge. You will learn everything, but their empire will be extremely angry.
Release Release the prisoners. Release the prisoners. Keeping the peace is most important to you. The other empire will be very grateful.
The Warship You question your prisoners again and again, and gradually the truth comes out.
Apparently, their empire has been sending a vessel into your territory to spy on you. One of the most advanced vessels they possess, this warship is outfitted with a stealth technology that makes it invisible to your sensors.
Even more disturbing, the ship was in the process of testing a new weapon--deep inside your territory--when it suddenly went silent. The ship is still broadcasting a location, however, on an encrypted channel.
The shuttle that you captured was on their way to rendezvous with the cloaked warship. The scientist is an expert in biological weapons; she claims that the stealthed vessel is not safe to board and that it should be returned to her empire immediately.
Take Take the warship. Take the warship. You will learn a lot by studying the weapons of your enemy. You will learn a lot by studying the ship.
Destroy Destroy the vessel. Destroy the vessel. You will remove the threat while simultaneously punishing your enemy for their deception. You will neutralize any possible threat from the vessel.
Return Return the ship. Return the ship to the offending empire with the understanding that they better respect your sovereign space in the future. The rival empire will be humbled by the return of their vessel.
The Warship The marines are able to take an excessive amount of punishment. The scientist ends up being their weakness, however. When you threaten to do her harm, one of the marines breaks down and confesses everything.
Apparently, their empire has been sending a vessel into your territory for quite some time; months, if not years.
They have been using a stealthed warship--the most advanced vessel they possess--to collect information about your systems and your fleets.
They were testing a new weapon--deep inside your territory--when the ship suddenly went silent. Their listening stations have been trying to make contact with the vessel for three days now, but there has been no response. The ship is still broadcasting a location, however, on an encrypted channel.
The shuttle that you captured was on their way to rendezvous with the cloaked warship. The scientist is an expert in biological weapons; she claims that the stealthed vessel is not safe to board and that it should be returned to her empire immediately.
Take Take the warship. Take the warship. You will learn a lot by studying the weapons of your enemy. You will learn a lot by studying the ship.
Destroy Destroy the vessel. Destroy the vessel. You will remove the threat while simultaneously punishing your enemy for their deception. You will neutralize any possible threat from the vessel.
Return Return the ship. Return the ship to the offending empire with the understanding that they better respect your sovereign space in the future. The rival empire will be humbled by the return of their vessel.
Warship Taken You arrive at the coordinates that the enemy scientist provides. The cloaking technology is so advanced that it takes several days just to locate the vessel.
When your soldiers board the warship, they are confronted with a gruesome scene. Most of the enemy crew is dead; and the ones that are still alive seem to be infected by some sort of viral pathogen. Their blood has darkened--turning nearly black--and they seem consumed by a mindless rage. The walls are splashed with the gore and viscera of their former crewmates.
Regardless, the warship is now yours.
After a lengthy quarantine, you have the vessel towed to one of your nearest research labs. It will be studied and the foreign technology will be assimilated.
Warship Taken The Warship storyline has ended. Narrative event This is one of many possible endings for this storyline.
Warship Destroyed You arrive at the coordinates that the enemy scientist provides. The cloaking technology is so advanced that it takes several days just to locate the vessel.
A few well-placed blasts disable the stealth drive, and you get your first look at their flagship. Long, sleek lines fade into powerful engines and cannons. In a battle, this vessel would be a deadly challenge. But in it's current state--defenseless and unresponsive--it's easy work to obliterate the warship.
Shortly after the vessel is destroyed, you receive angry and threatening messages from the rival empire. They promise retribution when you least expect it.
Warship Destroyed The Warship storyline has ended. Narrative event This is one of many possible endings for this storyline.
Warship Returned You arrive at the coordinates that the enemy scientist provides. The cloaking technology is so advanced that you never would have discovered the vessel without her help.
While you secretly record her process, you allow the scientist to broadcast an encrypted signal from your ship's systems. The stealthed warship responds by automatically decloaking. Your military research teams are sure to appreciate the codes and data that you forward to them.
There is minimal gunfire once their team is on board, and they quickly take control of the warship. They waste no time in powering up the vessel and setting course back to their home system.
You receive a final message through diplomatic channels. Their ambassador--deeply embarrassed by the incident--thanks you for your understanding and promises to avoid future misunderstandings.
Warship Returned The Warship storyline has ended. Narrative event This is one of many possible endings for this storyline.
Foreign Agents Your intelligence agencies inform you that foreign agents are up to something in your space. Multiple groups have been tracked to one of your smaller colonies. Unfortunately, they are already gone when your soldiers and war vessels arrive.
Residual traces suggest that a large, military vessel was recently in the area, but none of your scanning facilities ever picked up anything on their screens.
Whatever they were doing, the foreign agents are now gone.
Warship Retrieved The Warship storyline has ended. Narrative event This is one of many possible endings for this storyline.
The Rage There is an incident at one of your military research facilities.
It appears that someone kept information from you. Years prior--when you captured an advanced, enemy warship--one of your soldiers did not make it out of quarantine. He became infected with a viral pathogen that caused him to hallucinate and grow violent.
Your advisors come to you and show you the video of his transformation. Black veins sprawling across his skin. Eyes glazed over in total darkness. His mind becomes incoherent and he soon loses the ability to speak; to eat; or to function in any normal way. He screams and screams, clawing at the walls until the skin is torn from the bones of his hands.
Your scientists have been studying him for years now, trying to isolate the infection. Somehow the virus escaped containment, and it seems that you've lost contact with the entire research facility where it was being studied. No one from the orbital research station is responding to your messages.
The Rage Epilogue for The Warship storyline. Narrative event This final event provides flavor for the quest line. -->
The Rage Your spies hear talk of a disaster in one of your neighboring empires; something to do with a biological weapon.
Their news networks suggest that the colony suffered a terrorist attack, but your operatives tell you that this is just a cover story. A weaponized virus was released by their government--either intentionally or by accident--on the small, border outpost. No one seems to have survived, and the area is now under strict quarantine.
The Rage Epilogue for The Warship storyline. Narrative event This final event provides flavor for the quest line. -->
